pros: Company had a very large range of products coming from the merger of three separate companies. This meant that they were able to offer huge options to clients. With a large number of staff were able to cater for differing product requirements.
cons: With a large product range, integration was often an issue. Was however being improved. Slow rationalization of processes from the two main merger companies meant that there were often conflicts between the way things were done in one part of the organisation and another. E.G. UK and US.

pros: Worked in the Vic office. There were some genuinely good and friendly staff.
cons:
Worked ther for 3 months, company failed to pay me. 

Nokia has NO Management or leaders, the result is no direction or strategy.

Political  correctness takes precedence over the success of projects, naturally there are some women who don't hesitate to abuse it and turn their workplace into a bloodbath, HR will always back them, even if you record them lying and screaming abuse at others making the office environment hell on earth.

Everything is outsourced to India or China, all of the skilled staff that once steered the ship have left, now the company is run by 3rd world people delivering a 3rd world service/product.

You WILL work 12-14 hour days to correct the poor work delivered by these  3rd world countries.

review_title: Kick ass at Nokia if you LOVE what you do!
job_title: User Experience Architect in Irving, TX
pros: Really intelligent and knowledgeable people, amazing focus on strategy, challenging work, and an open environment for wild and passionate ideas. Surprisingly for an organization that is so huge, it is very agile and always changing. You are never bored. There is also a very significant mac community that has their own forum and mailing list to chat about aspects of Apple support, tips and tricks.
cons: You can feel like a tiny speck in an ocean at times. It can be frustrating when you realize some processes are in place for the sake of process and measurement and not for optimal or quick outcome.

review_title: Has been a Great Experience but will Need to Move on....
pros:
Work-Life Balance...
Benefits Especially the 401K Match
Work with latest Technology
Industry Recognized Name which is a good Resume Builder
Good Trainings
cons:
No Upward Lateral Movement
Middle Management has no power for any decisions
Company is losing its "innovative" culture
Massive People exiting the organization..hard to keep motivated while building blocks are falling down around you...

review_title: A unique work environment but struggling with innovation being held back.
job_title: Senior Design Engineer in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Until the time I left Nokia, especially Nokia Denmark had a unique, informal work environment providing a home away from home. As an engineer your involvement in projects stretched all through all aspects of project work from managing to implementing and testing. Nokia is a truly global and diverse company with colleagues comin from and located in all corners of the world.
cons: The downfall of Nokia was, in my opinion, in great part due to stubbornness, arrogant leaders, and a constant tendency to hold back innovation due to lack of willingness to take risks and do the unexpected (and costly). Currently, the economical situation for Nokia is quite uncertain.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Hangzhou, Zhejiang
pros:
The pros of working in NSN is that it is one of the biggest telecom companies in the world to work for. The name has excellent recognition due to the branding of the previously independant companies, Nokia and Siemens Communications.

The recent Global Financial Crisis has brought spending to a standstill but they had some positive policies in place such as paid instructor-led training every 6 months, broadband allowance and good on-call support rates.

Some of the other benefits include corporate company days where all staff go and spend a night at a resort and have a lot of fun activities.
cons: It's a new company so its hard to say whether the cons are with the company or with the economy. The cons at the moment are that all spending is strictly monitored.

review_title: 2 years at NSN Middle East's dynamic company NSN
pros: The company is dynamic and flexible. These are the two words that describe it best. there is a trust relationship which was a key differentiator especially compared to other companies in this region. The business ethics is noticeable as well. Individuals are appreciated and their efforts are recognised usually by the management.
cons: I was at a time following the merger between Nokia and Siemens and the process took so long with many re-organisations done for the following years. That created un-stability and people were mostly identifying themselves as ex-Nokia and ex-Siemens employees.

job_title: Technical Test Lead in East China, MI
pros: Nokia is a good company to work with, as it has the quickly decision and very strong leadship team, so it is easy to top down to have the right decision and transformation very quickly. now it goes to different industry like consumer and health besides the traditional telecommunication industry.
cons: sometimes, it is very big with over 110,000 employees and it is hard to turn around with many sites to line up and go with. so it is behind of HUAWEI and i think it is going well if the transformation goes successfully.

pros: Early career : lot of learning opportunities once in an assigned project. very good support for personal and work life aspirations and supportive management. especially superiors in Finland are very supportive once you have built your exposure and brand in a group
cons: Career advancement will hit a slow pace as there is more middle level experience across groups and finding a suitable internal opportunity gets difficult. At times there are instances that less experienced/performant people grow. Once there is experience added, reporting outside your local country/group might deny local opportunities. Frequent re-organizations also demotivate a lot of young aspirants.

pros:
Nokia as a company encourages continuous learning. You are encouraged to take up courses and learn as you wish. It also has an innovation mindset with a lot of opportunities to showcase your ideas and thoughts.  Good company to work if have an entrepreneur spirit and likes to work for big companies.
You can avail work from home but is not encouraged.
cons:
Work pressure is entirely dependent on your team and manager. Even though Nokia as a company encourages a good work-life balance, sometimes the team managers push the employees to work more to achieve deadlines. But you are free to reject this requests.
Employee perks like parent insurance are not free.

review_title: Decent company to work for with ongoing transforming still clearly present
job_title: Senior Solutions Sales Manager in Dubai
pros: Fair employer, plenty of possibilities in different areas. Competitive company in the market allows more possibilities. Plenty of traveling for those who like it.  Global company with fair treatment of employees. Decent salary level if working outside of Finland atleast.
cons: Merge with S and N is still ongoing, plenty of politics come to place as companies work very differently in past as separate entities. Company selected Nokia model in most processes leading some unhappiness from ex-S side. Costs are kept low and training possibilities are lacking. As company is only 2 years old there is lot of movement in different positions.

review_title: In a tough turnaround situation but culture is fantastic and fighting spirit alive and well.
pros: Open respectful environment where everyone is free to express ideas/complaints via internal "Twitter" and CEO Stephen Elop regularly responds.  When he 1st started there was a "holy #$#$" moment when someone posted a rather critical comment and Stephen immediately responded with a very candid and open response.  Say what you will about MS decision but I doubt there are many CEO's of a company this size as accessible as Stephen.
cons: Still too many people longing for the past and not recognizing the turnaround situation we're in.

review_title: Developers and designers are brilliant, Management inept and corrupt.
pros: Nokia has some brilliant designers, developers and engineers. In some parts of the world, Nokia is still a valued brand.
cons: The management under Elop operated on the crony system with decisions are based on rewards for those in upper management, not the company. Employees were treated like commodities. In general, management communication to employees was hollow and patronizing. A few executives showed sincere interest in the welfare of their teams,  but they did not dare criticize the Elop gang. The status quo wasn't working, but they threw out the baby with the bathwater when they brought in Elop and his gang.

pros:
- Salary is on par with many other product companies
- New technology products are interesting
cons:
- Attitude of Indian NSN, has changed a lot. Employees get nothing other than salary. They have cut everything just by taking the name of cost cutting
- Even work culture has changed a lot. So stressful these days. Doesnt sound like a finnish company.
- Real estate is biggest joke at this moment. Two peoples are alloted per seating desk saying cost cutting. There is no place to breathe also. Such a crampy work place i have seen in my 7 years of experience

review_title: Decent job but expectation might mismatch
job_title: R&Amp; D Engineer II in Bangalore
pros:
I was fortunate to get lots of great work, though most of the other components does not have interesting work including the one I was in.
Quite a lot of events happen.
cons:
No pay parity.
Transparency issues.
Have a very stringent hiring process which is not in line with the work that one is required to do.
Quite a few potential politicians can be found.
Too much of favoritism.
Work from home just for name sake(at least this was the case in our team)
Hike for new joinees not consistent.

review_title: Nokia is an ok company to work for
pros: Work life balance is great, benefits are competitive, youthful employee culture, the projects are interesting, also you can learn a lot as a programmer if you're a junior.
cons: Like any other corporation - approval chains are super long (even if you want to order a computer screen - we waited 12 months to receive the approval); tools over tools - some super old and inefficient (again, like any other corporation).

pros: Highly international context, various top experts in the ICT domain, modern work culture, state of the art technology, processes, and tools. I appreciate most the open management style, both in communication and in autonomy given to individual engineers. Furthermore, I always had the opportunity to work in various countries, and to evolve my role whenever I kind of felt going into routine mode and wanted to learn and renew.
cons: Very large company, hard to get a complete view on the whole, slow in changing. With respect to salary and other benefits, I have the feeling they target to be just above average, but always fair and reliable.

job_title: R&D Manager in San Diego, CA
pros:
Nokia has a good work culture. Working in teams is very well achieved and egos are not as big as in many US companies. You get to work in great devices. Nokia makes 400 million cell phones.
Work life balance is very good. 401K = 8% of pay with 100% match.
cons: Work can be quite process oriented. Decision making is slow. Europe has a holier than thou view of looking at US operations. Pay is honestly not very competitive. 401K match makes up for it. Options and restrictive shares are not offered as much as other companies. Bonus pay is average (15% expected) but quite steady.

review_title: Great place to work with motivated and energetic people, although ideas are often left unheard
job_title: Software Engineer in San Diego, CA
pros: The Work-Life balance at Nokia is the greatest draw.  They understand the correlation between work and life; how a well balanced life with family and friends promotes and replenishes one to be ready to work each day.  I never felt overworked, yet a lot was accomplished.
cons: Nokia is a well oiled machine running at an incredible pace.  It is very difficult to make significant changes in the engineering design and business model.  Worker input seems ineffectual most of the time.  Compensation is slightly below average.

review_title: Great place to work but negotiate a good package at the start.
job_title: R&D Technician III in San Diego, CA
pros: Great people to work for.  Laid back attitude.  Overall, the company takes good care of its employees.
cons: Pay scale and HR policies.  If you decide to work there, make sure you negotiate a good package up front because it is next to impossible to move up quickly if you started much too low in the pay scale.  Even if direct management says you deserve it and that you're being way underpaid, HR policies will keep them from doing anything meaningful about it.

review_title: Heaven or hell, depending on location and role
pros:
Depending on where you work, and in which part of the organisation: 
- advancement opportunity
- professional development opportunity
- work/life balance is excellent
- value driven organisation

Choose carefully on joining and consider your future aspirations heavily while doing so. This could be the difference between turning up for work looking forward to the challenges it brings, and turning up for work being a challenge in itself.
cons:
Depending on where you work, and in which part of the organisation: 
- (opposite of all of the above)
- huge gulf in between leadership abilities of Senior & Junior management
- plenty of dead end roles
- pockets of stagnation

review_title: I loved to work for Nokia and gave everything - but after 30y I was fired like many other old farts
pros:
Its a hughe company and you have almost endless possibilities to choose your career path, country, organization, function etc.
The colleagues are the best - mainly. The team spirit and feeliong of doing things together is high.
cons:
In some organizations the "domestic policy" overrules everything else and its forbidden to use your brains. 
Middle management is eager to save their own ash only. 
Some people do not see far enough and easily save a cent here and waste an euro there.

review_title: Working at Nokia Siemens Networks is like being at home
pros:
* They have good products on hand, which can make them market leaders.
* Excellent Work life balance.
* No work pressure at all
* Cross site culture is good, give exposure and visibility.
* Agile way of working
* Friendly working atmosphere, dont have to worry about saying you opinion to anybody.
cons:
* No customer focus, hence loosing marketability
* Cost cutting big time, very less sal, false promises of hikes, meagre increase, 0 employee benefits.
* 0 employee retention.
* No fun activities, more like a govt company, all you get is your sal, nothing more than that.
* Learning curve is static, after a point,  the work becomes monotonous with  no challenges.

review_title: Best place to work with best people- very much satisfied
pros:
I have worked in NOKIA around 4yrs which was fornally NSN. 
- work environment is too good
- very good learning,improves domain knowledge
- your hard work is very well recognized
- understanding managers and peers jump in to help you at your work when required
- great work life balance and friendly people everywhere
-fun at work
- your initiatives are well considers, encouragement to improve leadership skills
cons:
-No onsite opportunity
- hike will be based on your current project.
- not much facilities provided by the company

Not many cons as its one of the best companies to work with.

review_title: Nice company for your first career steps
pros: Nice company to start your Career as an entry level. You can learn ways and processes of an enormous , well established and organised company which will help you in your next career steps.
cons: Salaries are low with the minimum potential for raise. Technologies used are mostly old and this does not help you to grow as an engineer, of course this depends on the product assigned  but many people work with internal tools for years, a fact that can be considered as a career killer. People working there have neither the chance nor the attitude to grow as professionals something that leads in having co workers with very poor skill set.

pros:
Nokia are a Finnish company and treat their employees with a lot of respect. There are many benefits such as a company mobile phone, financial support for health activities, flexible working hours, etc. I found that they were also very flexible about working arrangements.

In addition I found the actual work to be interesting and challenging, and the quality of the Software Engineers I worked with was very high.
cons: It really depends on your role and team. I was in a satellite team geographically distant from the core team. I found this frustrating. This problem was exacerbated by bans on air travel as an attempt to reduce costs.

review_title: Starting with good potential, it dissapointed by the end.
pros: German work laws as well as conditions achieved through union negotiations result in an extremely flexible work environment, both strictly limiting overtime as well as allowing the accumulation of hours for combining with vacation days, allowing frequent and long vacations.
cons: It is a large company whose employee actions are mostly driven by short sighted provincialism with regard to protecting ones own job/pet project/influence, etc. Essential business decisions remain unmade over several years, while one "team" after another is tasked with recommending the best decisions, the recommendations then dutifully ignored.

pros:
The company trust's it's employees. A wonderful thing, except that many take advantage of this.
Awesome benefits - medical, leased car, mobile phone bills, broadband, new phones every 2 years, laptops etc.
Bangalore R&D is not treated as a software backend "sweat-shop".
cons:
Trust is misused by many - it's common to find senior managers with no competence comfortably building fiefdoms in Nokia.
Too many re-organization's; with every re-org a common theme is that the good people get laid off, and the idiots manage to find jobs.
No job security beyond 6 months.

review_title: Lot of talented people, but hubris of upper management was the company's undoing
pros: Get to work with a lot of smart, motivated, and dedicated people. Fast-paced, only constant is change. Keeps you on your toes, but you learn a lot as well. Classy company. Very environmentally conscious.
cons: Too many middle managers, trying to build their own little empires. Slow decision-making. Too much concern about job security leads to flawed decision-making and missed opportunities to innovate and stay current. Euro-centric world view. Slow to react to US market realities. Process-heavy.

review_title: Right place, wrong time. A stumbling giant.
job_title: Senior Visual Designer in Vancouver, BC
pros: Excellent benefits and life-work balance.  A Global workplace with opportunity to travel and work with people around the world. Potentially huge audience for final product.
cons: Way too much focus on maintaning and iterating on spec docs and style guides. 'agile' is a buzzword used without any comprehension of how an agile process actually works.  Design and engineering are not integrated within a production team.  The programmer who works on implementing designs may be in another country, but even within the same office they report to a different manager, and sit somewhere else in the building.  Very splintered environment with poor focus on goals and results.  Teams and products being slashed in an effort to keep the company viable.

review_title: Good place to work if you are under a right team and right boss
pros: Had good work culture few years back but is deteriorating gradually.
cons: No proper resource management, resource skills and potential are not utilized properly, but this is not the case in all regions though.

review_title: Great learning opportunity, wages not the greatest
pros: Great people to work with, chance to grow and learn new things. I really enjoyed working with new technology and processes; learned how to use Agile methodologies to improve software and processes
cons: Communication between teams and between management and workers is not good.  Every year that's the number one issue on the employee surveys and every year there's a band-aid approach to fixing it.  No one wants to trust anyone with information before it's absolutely necessary, which has everyone feeling like it's a very adversarial environment.  Oh, and the wages are low compared to other companies.

pros: Salary is competitive, and people got a lot of freedom in that company. Arrange the time all by yourself as long as you could finish the tasks on time. Groups also have some weekly group party funding. It's a nice place to enjoy working.
cons: It's a large company, which means each one is just a small part of that big machine. There is very few hero here. So sometimes you have to accept that even if you really want to do some more challenging works, you won't get it.

review_title: Good work life balance & perks,but less job stability.
pros: Good work life balance. Good perks. World's leading brand in mobile phones. Salary is better than services companies. On par with some product companies.
cons: Too much of process and hierarchy. Office politics. Recently going down to competition in phone business. Less job security. Quality of work is not as good, but i feel in most of the s/w companies in India the case is same. Work is mostly maintenance or feature enhancement. Very less development from scratch.

pros:
-Smart resilient people having survived enormous change.
-New strategy seem to be more relevant to todays' market - but will it be enough?
-Better results for Q4 2012, Q1 2013. However, much of this due to severe cost cutting on top of existing sales pipeline. Will it last?
cons:
-Hard industry with rapidly diminishing margins and commoditisation of equipment which is primarily out of china now.
-Poor product differentiation compared to Competitors.
-Strong non-telco vendors quickly gaining market share.
-Poor prospects with two parent organisations wishing to disengage from the organisation as soon as possible
-Strong competitors rapidly taking away market share.

review_title: A great company for those who don't like to think or do
pros: work life balance is usually great, good work environment. Some great co-workers.
cons: confusing, frustrating, irritating management decisions. No real structure to anything that is being done. Lack of communication between groups will be the downfall of the this company. Vision for the future is too nokia specific don't know how to create a clear vision and be aware of where the real competition is hiding. Every single engineer will become extremely frustrated at some point at this company.

pros: I had an amazing experience while doing my internship at Nokia! Nokia Belgium offers very diverse and dynamic working environment which provides great possibilities and opportunities - I was working on challenging projects which enhanced my personal and professional growth, got to know how a big international company such as Nokia operates, and what is more, I was surrounded by very friendly and helpful colleagues with who I remained in touch even after the end of my internship! Thank you Nokia for this great experience!
cons: Nothing comes to my mind to be honest

review_title: Good in theory, just average in practice, ok overall
pros:
Truly global, the concept of country does not exist
Communication and information sharing
Modern, fresh management style
Flexibility
Excellent work practices and metodologies (at least in theory)
Good work atmosphere
A great deal of tolerance for mistakes
A great variety of roles and geographic locations
cons:
Low salaries
Academic background counts very little
Interna processes are good in theory but heavy, difficult to understand and almost impossible to follow in practice
Too often promotions are not based on merit but on personal relationships
Too many middle management positions that are not really needed
Internal job market is not transparent

review_title: Good as can get for a tough product situation and leadership self-preservation
pros:
- Improving product rapidly
- Some smart people
- Good benefits & internal communications
- Partnership with Microsoft is hopeful
cons:
- HR not holding senior leadership accountable
- Lack of visibility for middle management to senior leadership (no opportunities to shine or get recongized because senior management is trying to hard to control)
- Micromanagement of expenses/projects kills the motivation and can-do attitude for which your employees are hired and valued

review_title: Big ideas, but an uncertain future
job_title: Communications Manager in White Plains, NY
pros: Great people who are passionate about their jobs and the work that they do. You will meet bright, hard-working people who understand the very best of today's mobile technologies. And, they make some of the best phones you will ever use.
cons: I loved my time at Nokia - about 4 years. But today, the future of the company - especially in N. America - is very uncertain. If they start to get optimal carrier support for their new Windows-based smartphones, then maybe they can turn things around - but there are a lot of risks.

review_title: nice and exiting experience in developing new business, turned into a bad one with the reorganization
pros: Great Radio Access technology and still some trust within CSP
cons: Continuous reorganizations without a clear strategy create confusion to customers and to sales and delivery force; continuous head count reduction compromise employee trust in company future and CSP trust NSN is capable to address their need in long term, thus orienting CSP to buy product from cheapest Vendor.

review_title: Great company to start in, with a lot of freedom and self-management
job_title: R&D Engineer in Quezon City, National Capital Region
pros:
- Gives a lot of freedom and self-management to its employees
- Benefits are above average and improving
- Gives an insight to agile culture
- Has a lot of activities outside of work that are fun like Family day, sports fest and etc.
- Really great energy with a lot of young people
- Nice work-life balance
cons:
- Obsolete technologies
- Not enough career opportunities above entry level in technical field (need to transfer to management)
- Some of the management seem to think too highly of themselves, and thus fail to listen to others or be emphatic
- Middle management uses valuable human-resources for self-promotion

pros: You can work very independently, where ever you want, and take time off quite flexibly if your tasks allow you to do so.  Have had some very good managers and coaches in the company but also experienced the challenges.
cons: Decision making is a general issues though. Lots of politics and inefficiency. You have to put in long hours, weekends etc. At the same time you see a lot of people in the company who have not had anything to do for a long time.

review_title: company is full of incompetence at management levels... most of the people who knew what they are doing are gone.
pros:
compensation is fair
global exposure and travel
some opportunities to rise to your highest level of incompetence
only way to get promoted is to move to Finland
cons:
even high achievers are let go in mass layoffs
most competent people have left the company by now
if you're not Finish, forget it.
long working hours if you are in other region besides Europe
pay increases are minimal at best match cost of living during good years
terrible management from middle all the way up the ladder... CEO is arrogant
promotion within is non-existant
if you are not use to Finish culture, get ready for "passive aggressive" oversight

review_title: Amazing... Could have been better if my boss was good...
job_title: OSS Care Engineer in Gurgaon, Haryana
pros: Amazing salaries... especially to the experienced ones...  Roam the country even the world if u have the right job.. Great perks.. super cool people..
cons: Joining as a fresher not so much of a great idea... u gotta do all sorts of jobs.. roaming from site to site.. some even have to climb cell phone towers..

pros: Many of the individual contributors are outstanding. The internal culture values friendliness and cooperation which makes for a pleasant place to work. Vacation and work/life policies are excellent, as are the salaries.
cons:
All major decisions are made in Europe and much of the decision making is informal; the formal process ratifies what has been decided over coffee. For any organization based elsewhere this is challenging.

The map landscape and user expectations have been changing rapidly in the past few years and Nokia/HERE has struggled to keep up. Senior leadership is thrashing and it shows with frequent changes of direction and decisions that are reversed back and forth multiple times.

pros:
Nokia Value: respect each other, open communication, not bureaucratic, support work life balance. 
I never any of the manager have his/her own office, even the vice present are sit in open area together with other employees
Nokia not encourage over time work unless it is inevitable, and officially support work and life balance, and this is taking into account in the daily execution
Nokia are respect to all the countries and cultures in internal communication.
cons:
Execution, schedule behind the Chinese competitor. Nokia product are lower competence with Huawei and schedule are hehind the Huawei also.
big acquisition bring unstable in management. especially in China, as NSB will be a separated entity , it is not clear how it will be impacted to daily execution in china.

review_title: Best telecom company(inc operator/ISP/OEM) in india ,
job_title: JG-10 (IP NPO & Engineering Manager) in Mumbai
pros:
I have workd in almost all telecom giant company including Tata . Bharti .reliance and stable in nokia last 6 years .

Nokia is European MNCs with ethic and culture flexi hours .
wide options of projects , Board of management is very transparent. 
very safe in terms of job security comparing other Indian telecom industries 
promotion purely based on merit
cons:
Tax benefit is okey but can be further optimises to benefit employees .
office premises has degraded its ambience in past few years ..office premises is not at par with Nokia image ...

job_title: Distinguished Member of Technical Staff in Murray Hill, NJ
pros: Very flexible work schedule; not much of project work; we can conduct academic type fundamental research; possibility to attend leading conferences and present your research results; publishing in leading research journals is considered as work achievement
cons: Salaries are lower than in other communications (and related) companies. For example Qualcomm and Huawei pays visibly more. University professors are also paid better now days. Google and Facebook pay much more. Because of that good researchers are actively leaving Bell Labs, and good new ones do not want to come here.

review_title: Good overall company to work for but some definite drawbacks in some entry level support roles
job_title: Customer Applications Engineer in Kanata, ON
pros:
- Top shelf pay and benefits
- Managers are trained to do what managers should do
- Company is moving towards more current open and collaborative environment and culture, which could still improve, but also holds to more classic approaches, which I actually do like in some ways (fewer distractions)
cons:
Specific to some support teams:
- Hellish on-call weeks (expect 80hrs+, round the clock, days with no sleep)
- No room for more broadly applicable skill and knowledge growth

review_title: A great choice if you want to learn and work
pros: As worked with GNOC, Noida for Nokia Siemens Networks, its a great choice at initial levels, great learning opportunities, value your work, support for your work, appreciations, increased roles and responsibilities according to employee's attitude, platform for innovations, provide platforms to go upper levels. Very comfortable working environment and infrastructure. No differences for external and internal employees (off rolls and on rolls). A very safe and sound environment being female employees.
cons: Dissatisfied compensation if u are junior levels, partial visibility of company policies, very less fun activities, no team building exercises, no compensations for your extra work, management is not up to the mark, you should know how to manage the things under pressure as well.

pros: All of the peripheral knowledge I've gained is great, it just has nothing directly to do with my job at all. Love my direct work team. Every once in awhile I get to see something amazing but then the meeting ends and I have to go back to my normal work.
cons: Reorganized management, department, department name(s) several times in ~3 years. Upper management out of touch with people without "manager" or "supervisor" in their title. Pay is poor and when I attempted to correct this I was given a piece of paper that defined "at will employment" for me. No room for advancement. Teams are more concerned with completing sprint reviews, epochs, and stories rather than actually making functional products.

pros: Great products, Market knowledge and reputation, good compensation package and benefits. Stressfull workload in some áreas while in others there is still excess of people
cons: Politics still matters much. Unreallistic target setting for non aligned people. Leadership lacks in communication, transparency and professionalism. Respect for individuals declined in the last 3 years. May have done a good job for restructuring but does not have the profile for growth or innovation. The Leadership punishes conflict and ideas that challenge the status quo, too centralized approach working as castes, which kills innovation and technology.

pros:
Lots of flexibility at Nokia. Ability to work from home and choose your hours. Excellent systems: SAP and other good interfacing tools. Fun projects. Great diverse teams and casual work environment.
Lots of career opportunities if you are mobile or willing to change functions.
cons: Nokia goes through 1 - 2 organisational restructure every single year, and rarely gives the chance to test if the restructure is working well before making another change. It puts a lot of pressure on everyone & people are so stressed that most are just "getting by" and doing the minimum, instead of driving engagement and seeing employees giving it their all.

pros: I spent nearly 13 years at Nokia and have virtually nothing but positive things to say about my experience.  They strongly encouraged internal job rotations, so I had incredible opportunities to experience a wide range of different areas of the company.  The culture was extremely supportive and the organizational hierarchy was very flat.  If you were bored at Nokia, you only had yourself to blame because they were always working on new, cutting edge products and technology- if you were feeling tired in your current role/organization, then you could easily find something else within the company if you just looked around.
cons: While Nokia did make a concerted effort to offer competitive salaries for the past few years, for many years (especially when they were they dominated the global cell-phone market) they paid considerably less than industry standard.  There was a bit of ego in the compensation policies, and I often felt an unstated code of "you're lucky you get to work for Nokia, if you want to get paid more go somewhere else...".  The fact is however, it was true.  I stayed there for the MANY other benefits (financial, professional and academic), and eventually my salary was above industry norm.

review_title: Not nearly as good as expected
pros: good work life balance in most cases. Average Salaries comparing to other companies in the industry. No problems with payments even in extreme cases of capital controls. Raises are tiny non important.
cons: Most projects include legacy very hard to maintain code. Languages used are mostly proprietary nokia while modern software engineering techniques are ignored or not known at all. Managers are at most not at all technical exprerienced and also having trouble on managing their staff.  Employees are over estimated and others under estimated.

review_title: Good Work Life but partial to acquired companies
pros: work life balance and good processes
cons:
1) benefits given to recently acquired companies are more. Ex:- Transport cabs are given to all the employees for the newly acquired company but for employees of sec-62 Noida, there is no such facility
2) Products group across movement is difficult
3) Product support allowance given to newly acquired companies is more.
4) Job grades were increased for some of the people managers whose job is to just supply resource
5) Re-orgs are frequent but no impact to higher grade resource managers.

review_title: Nokia was great to work for until Microsoft  came in and changed the environment and moved everyone or layed them off.
pros: WAS a great company to work for.  Clear processes, great atmosphere, Global teams were great.  Very high tech.  They did everything first....but didnt follow thru with commercialization.
cons: No money spent on marketing in USA.  Microsoft management people now in place.  They dont care about the individuals that were there and made Nokia one of top 6 brands in world.  They just layed them all off and replace with California MS people.

review_title: Corporation that stepped to the arrogant management minefield
pros: At best, work and decisions could be done with a lean organisation with accountable individuals and team leads. Usually the people in specialist and key contibutor roles were exceptional, nice-to-work-with colleagues.
cons: Internal innovation process was sluggish, due to fairly complicated organization and decision making structure between unit divisions. VP level management was also not very approachable. Constant re-organizations and organization box games kept the management busy, also wiping away a lot of effort the resources in teams could have accomplished if lead in a better way.

pros: The working time is VERY flexible. There are also lot of leisure facilities. No overtime needed.
cons: The salary is an average (or below average) without any increase or well defined career path to follow, so I'd rather not recommend it to newcomers. There have been many layoffs recently, so there are no bonuses at all. The senior management is also quite clumsy, the last three years were disastrous (I write this in 2013)

review_title: It depends on the line manager
pros: Flexible work hours, fix salary, you'll learn the difference between coding and product development. If you are lucky, then you can work on interesting projects and really good people. After a few years you can be quite autonomous.
cons:
Some projects are boring, same day, same things to do. Other projects can be chaotic and politics driven. Good luck finding the one you like.
Some line managers are not doing what they expect from engineers: doing what they are paid for.

review_title: A good place to work and  improve yourself
pros:
In Nokia, work and life are totally balanced. You will have a good career path. Your manager will help you with your competency development and planning your career path. 
There are many training courses every year. You can learn the knowledge and skills for your career. You can learn from other experts during work.
It results originated. You will set your targets with your manager. And review the result once a year. You can adjust your targets. You can get an award once you complete your achievement.
The working environment is good. The working atmosphere is fantastic. There is no politics. 
It is a good place to work and improve yourself.
cons: None from my point of view.

review_title: The best company I have worked with in my 18 working experiences
job_title: R&D Team Lead in Beijing, Beijing
pros:
I have been working in NOKIA for 2 years, This is teh best company I have been worked with !!!!

Very Human management style.

company invest lots on people, noty only for wellbeing, but also for training and development.
 
Whatever which position ,you feel respect at all from meeting, work ,office and team works.

Best place for work and life , great paid leave, business travel caring, and all I have experiences.

Lots of fun in the work , team and people.
cons: Maybe too confortable for people, lot of people working here for a whole life.....getting lazy.

review_title: It was great working there, I had to leave the company for my career aspirations towards MBA Finance.
pros:
Great Culture, helps in maintaining a perfect work life balance. 
Good support by the higher management and it helps nurturing the talent in the organization. I hada  great team and we were like a family in the workplace.
cons: Some managers in the middle level come from IT services background and there is a huge cultural mismatch between their style of leading and the style as per NOKIA's values. this causes problems at times. Thank God it was not in my Team... :)

review_title: Great atmosphere as far as life-work balance
pros: Great collection of people -all pretty easy to get along with.  Benefits were great.  Ability to actually take your vacation days off was fantastic.  People WANTED you to go home when you were sick instead of wanting to you to stay to finish more work (and infect the rest of the office while you were at it).
cons: There were so many changes (in management and where you sat) and there were so many layoff scares that you never quite felt that you had any job security.

review_title: Nokia is THE BEST employee friendly company

Culture of respect

review_title: With company over 15 years. Role was always related to Learning & Development of the Care network.
job_title: Care Training Manager in Irving, TX
pros: Great benefits packages, and good work life balance culture. Friendly people to work with and collaborate on projects. Work spaces and meeting rooms/facilities were well structured for getting work done!
cons: Limited advancement opportunities and bonuses were sparse at best in the last five years. Many reorganization iterations in the past 6 years, most were always worried about job security, rightfully so both during Nokia Oy, and MSFT ownership of the Devices and Services businesses of Nokia, Inc.

pros: Very international team, very good work conditions and Informal work environment are the most appealing things in the company. Also the spirit to strive for better and innovative products to shape the future is part of the company's culture and a very inspiring reason to go to  work every day.
cons: Confuse organizational structure causes frustration and inefficiency more often than necessary. This causes too much time spend in politics and many times leads to waste of resources, as different departments try to achieve similar goes separately.

review_title: They will make you slave, will discriminate if you are Persian, Muslim, Have health issues or need to care for family!
pros: Good only if you are unemployed or need a US green card sponsor! Also a good training center to learn stuff about technology and also harsh politics and non-EEOC employer personality and then leave for an honorable work!

low wages and promoting wrong people ( buddies of management)
HR is not on your side and is part of the whole scam

pros: There is hardly any point which can be considered as positive.
cons: The job was offered because no native was interested at that time. After joining, I saw that the treatment is too biased towards the foreigners. They can't communicate in English even if the company is Finnish. Technical discussions were always held in German. No one cares whether an English speaking person is able to understand. During the coffee discussion some AfD supporters even show up and shares their views why Germany is better without the foreigners.

review_title: Hired as a software Engineer to develop features for the 5G in Nozay
pros:

-Good for starting your career
- Global environment 
-Very good HR system
cons:
