-No possibility for evolution , in a sense that you can't move up , if you are hired for position X , so hard to change or move up . After one or year , you will kill your career if you stay
-Sadly lots of young smart people leave due to the previous reasons

job_title: Business Development Manager in Mountain View, CA
pros: Global company in an interesting sector of tech. Huge changes to be expected in future. Big difference on cell phone today and ten years ago - HUGE difference between a cell phone in 2008 and in a 'cell phone' in 2018. Company supports out of box thinking and you are generally empowered to do what it takes to get the job done. No red tape.
cons: In rapid changes in company you are either on main stream of communication or almost blacked out. Processes supporting the business (HR, IT,...) are based on some unflexible template what are very different to main business related processes.

job_title: Cdma Engineer in San Diego, CA
pros:
friendly people. great work/life balance. never too stressful. work is the same stuff.  
great benefits package - insurance, time off, vacation....  nice campus - gym, tennis, basketball courts.  great location.
cons:
hard to move up.  get stuck where you are.  not always challenging.  you feel like anyone can do your job and you didnt need to go to college for it.

every year seems to fly by. the iips come and go and i dont think they are very helpful.  each year i feel like i am saying the same stuff and always receiving decent reviews.  

new team leads don't think u are ready to move up when they have barely worked with you.

review_title: Great company and very competitive salaries
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Boston, MA
pros: Great teams and very challenging problems to solve everyday and exciting work culture. Great salaries, I don't think any other company can pay you so much than nokia, unless you are working for Google/FB/Some highly funded start up.
cons: Management is the biggest drawback of this great company. Management in all departments which I dealt with are unbelievably useless. Technical decisions, feature sets are made and promised by product management who have no clue how they are done and what are its pros and cons. decisions making takes forever and ever.

pros: Flexible work conditions, e.g.working from home. Most of the engineers very competent and enthusiastic about what they want to accomplish.
cons: Still two cultures after 5 years after the merger. Inefficient and slow middle management. Almost complete lack of people perspective in strategic views (could be because of no diversity in executive board -- everybody there has sales background). Internal project/program management and coordination is terrible, based on what little I saw.

pros: There is a lot of talented and driven people at Nokia, and the latest products are really amazing. Nokia has managed to pull itself back from the brink of collapse. It went from being the best to not even being a contender. The attitude of the people at Nokia changed all that, and the company is now starting to recover and look strong again.
cons: Nokia has always been slow to respond to change. Whether that change has been in the economy or the ecosystem the response has always been too slow. Another major minus are the salaries. The pay is not good!

review_title: Overall, a good job that could have been better
pros: Co-workers were great -- some of the smartest folks I've known. In my environment, at least, the schedules were flexible, telecommuting was allowed, and the benefits were pretty good.
cons: The pay was okay, but raises corporate-wide were small and scarce. Communication from upper-management was, as I saw it, a one-way street, and only the "good stuff" was communicated. If there was something less than stellar, I typically didn't hear about it until I read about it on some third-party web site. Everything seemed to be a secret.

review_title: Wishful Thinking in Mobile Internet Services
job_title: Systems Administrator in Mountain View, CA
pros: Lots of respect from Finnish coworkers.  Very collaborative yet direct and honest approach.
cons: Lots of BS and ego from Silicon Valley acquisitions.  Finnish Nokians mistook belligerent Silicon Valley overconfidence for experience and competence.  Locals rose in management, and a year later the old-time Nokians realized they were reporting to ass-hats and incompetent lieutenants.

review_title: Promoted to a new role but a low increase
job_title: Scrum Master in Quezon City, National Capital Region
pros: Work life balance is very good, I Love the working environment
cons: low salary increase, 3 years external hire would have a higher compensation when compared to those who have already stayed in the company for 3 years

review_title: Good for right location and product - not so good for others
pros: Finally taking a broader diversity view and working to improve in that arena.   Socially conscious and working to improve.     Good benefits etc.
cons: Very focused on certain locations in company and pet products and if you're not in them, you get little support and targets for downsizing.   Many decisions made by slashing a line in a spreadsheet.

review_title: It's a place which you need to 'connect' with 'right' people
pros:
Flexible work hours / location, good work life balance (subject to team dynamics and boss approval) 
Clear work processes for some divisions
Generous payer to external support - agencies / consultants
cons:
Very liberal job rotation (some staff may not have the necessary skills to perform in their new roles)Over investment / redundant staff in R&D 
Slow to react to market need

pros: The best working team I ever had was in NSN. Even we were located around the globe, we could always trust each other to deliver what was agreed.
cons: Higher management has no respect for the people who actually do the work in the company. Organization changes too frequently, there is no time to actually see how things are evolving.

review_title: Company doesn't respect you at all. Your salary is based on your nationality not on the competence.
job_title: Senior Technical Support Engineer in Irving, TX
pros:
- 6% company match for 401k
- flexible work time
cons:
- It's very difficult to get any promotions.  Company is interested in the cheapest engineers. 
- Your salary is based on your nationality not on the competence. Finnish engineers have the highest salaries. On the same position engineer from LAM would get 60 000 - 70 000 $ per year. But Finnish engineer would get 90 000 - 100 000 $.
- Most managers don't respect you at all. You wouldn't get any compensation for the overtime or night work.

pros: Nokia is a good place to work if you want to care balance between life and work. In addition, Nokia can provide the platform to you if you have any innovative idea. Last but not least, Nokia has more annual leave here in China than most of local companies.
cons: Annual overral income  is not competitive compared with other IT companies here in China. Most of local companies provide  extra 3~5 months salary as year-end bonus. But you can only get more or less 1 month in Nokia.

review_title: No career growth oppotunity in Irving, but great if you are in Finland
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Irving, TX
pros: Smart people to work with, great benefits. Fun/interesting technologies and products to work on.
cons: Below average pay, no headcount growth thus no chance for advancement. The company focuses on retaining their Finish employees and they really don't care about their US employees. Constant threat of being offshored or jobs sent back to Finland. Schedules are unrealistic and you must work over time the whole year to make schedule. Five years ago, Nokia really focuses on work/life balance. Since 2006, in Irving, work/life balance went completely out the window. You get 4-5 weeks vacation (good) but can never take it due to constant schedule pressure (bad).

job_title: Chief Architect in Mountain View, CA
pros: Nokia is one of those employers that operates in a growing, exciting business and reacts rapidly on changes in the business environment making every day different and exciting. Sometimes of course too much change is too much. Mobility and European thinking inside the company makes Nokia a fantastic employer despite growth opportunities are somewhat limited unless you move to Finland/Europe.
cons: Working hours are too much based on Europe/Asia and global business and benefits, bonuses are based too much on overall sales, business performance. Some American leaders inside the company only consider their own benefit instead of the team.

review_title: Remarkable, learning continously, an opportunity to stay up to the latest trends
pros:
People who work there are great
Openess to innovative approaches
Need to make a turnaround quickly (and being part of it)
Industry type
cons:
Not "big enough jobs" for senior people and to avoid creating bad feelings, the more senior ones end up being engaged in activities where less experienced people might be engaged.
Never clear enough if you are or are not accountable, finally, for a specific result, and who else is sharing the same responsibility with you.

review_title: Good place to be in for a few years
pros:
Quality of work
Independence to take decisions
Good place to acquire domain knowledge in telecom
Work-life balance
cons:
Petty politics at lower management level
Perfect place for people who show-off
Too many unnecessary meetings. Work is impacted due to this
Compensation is not at par with market standards
Company struggling to be profitable since inception
Delay in releases is common

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Northbrook, IL
pros:
Salary is competitive, and there is an annual bonus.
Culture is very "European" (= good work/life balance).
Not certain about career opportunities - 

Benefits:
- 100% 401k match on up to 8% of your salary
- Good choice of medical plans
- Up to 30 days (6 weeks!) PTO
- 2 additional (paid) days of community service per year
- 10 additional days to take care of your family if someone is sick/injured
cons:
Uncertain future after the dramatic change of direction - no more cellphones.
Also, lots of changes in Top Management.
The company now has very diverse divisions:
- Nokia Networks
- Here (ex Navteq)
- IP (milking patents)

Who knows how this will end...

review_title: Good employer to gain wide knowledge from telekom area
pros:
- Access to newest telekom projects (4G, 5G) and different products (O&M, Transport etc.).
- Wide package of trainings from telekom, PM, softskill area.
- Very good atmosphere at work.
- Contact with different nations and customers all around the world.
cons:
- Different reorganizations during last few years (Nokia + Siemens -> Siemens out -> Nokia Solutions and Networks -> Nokia).
- Poor salaries in comparision to other competitors on the same market (i.e. within the same country, city).
- Nokia is always chasing the salaries of competitors, never set market target.
- Quite big rotation between employees, due to poor salaries.

pros:
1) Pathetic people.

2) A lot of idiots joined this company as freshers and they are still working. They have no become manager. They know nothing are have KIDDISH behavior. These useless people don't even want to do their excel work, that also they pass on to the junior technical resource. An then they say you dont work.
cons: FASTEST WAY TO DESTROY UR CAREER

review_title: Good Place to start your career, unfortunately you must leave after 2-3 years.
job_title: R&Amp; D Engineer in Athens, Attica
pros:
Nice culture. 
You work (mostly) on the latest technologies and they encourage to learn new things.
Well structured company.
Flexible working hours and remote working.
cons:
Very low salary, you barely make out every month. 
Too many management levels and positions. 
A lot of meetings, we even to meetings in order to see what we will discuss on another meeting. Ineffective we have a lot of waste.

pros: A great company with great culture and great people, deliverying great products to great customers across the great world. You will find all your happiness in your life when you work for Nokia.
cons: You will have to push yourself to be better everyday, and your responsibility will be expand a lot, and you will care about all people around you and you will want to try to achieve very challenging target, example, change the world.

job_title: R&D Engineer in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: Decent pay. Good people. They just need to be allowed to do what they were trained to do.
cons: This is absolutely the most toxic environment I have ever worked in. No time to do a proper job. Prototypes released with known problems. Engineers are throwing together evaluation boards from semiconductor vendors without truly understanding how they work. Cant blame the Engineers. What can you do when you have such a short design cycle. There isnt any time to research a problem and come up with a design to address the problem. Any product coming out of this facility is a ticking time bomb.

review_title: 3 years and counting (Quezon City Technology Center)
pros:
- Work life balance
- Flexi-time
- Gives the freedom of implementing projects to its employees (solutions coming from the employees).
- Office ambiance/working environment is amazing
- World class health benefits (the best in PH at the moment in my opinion)
- Competitive entry level salary.
cons:
- Very low yearly increase (compared to competing companies).
- Basis for promotions is VERY questionable (favoritism, non-technical contributions, etc.).
- It is very difficult to get a promotion within a team. Sometimes, the only means of promotion is switching to a different team/department/business line.

review_title: Great place to work if you're self driven
pros:
1) Empowered to make key decisions
2) Flexible work culture - work from home, personal time off, etc
3) Encouraged to learn skills beyond daily work
4) Mistakes are accepted as part of the learning curve
5) Enormous cultural diversity
6) Top class facilities & infrastructure
7) Everyone has a voice - can criticize anyone without fear or favor
cons:
1) People not aggressive enough wrt goals
2) Bewildering array of tools & processes - takes eons to understand
3) Workaholics will find it a bit difficult, as that culture is non-existent

pros:
-Great work life balance, work from home options
-managers understand personal commitments
-good benefits package, 25 vacation days is highest by any employer in India. free phone, call charges paid, free broadband at home
-most recognized brand in India, although it is doing badly worldwide
-above average salary compared to similar league companies in Bangalore
-depending on the team, you could be doing great work.
-bangalore is still a low cost option for nokia. job seems more secure compared to other locations worldwide
cons:
-hit on the innovative front, being hit badly by competition. always plays follower
-soon to lose the numero uno position
-bonuses are zero when all the other companies are doing well and paying fat bonuses

review_title: Got the exposure but not the skills
pros: Equal opportunity to some extents. Lots of trinings and career advancement opportunities available
cons: Was a good company to work for during its golden ages which are now gone by... lots of lobbying and you need to be in good eyes of your mgt if you want to stay onboard

review_title: Good learning experience for new grads and good facilities for employees.
pros: There is open communication between teams and recognition for a good life-work balance. There are inter-department team activities to encourage sharing between teams. Employers are pretty open-minded to suggestions and care about employees' well-being. Outside speakers are invited to give talks about relevant topics from time to time.
cons: Many of the entry level positions are filled by new grads or students who are working part-time out of university and would appreciate more mentorship from experienced individuals in their field.

pros: Great work culture and the way Nokia treats the employee, Nokia treats more than an employee
cons: Middle Management plays a major role in every company and if something goes wrong here, then the whole company is in a mess. Nokia is not an exception here , Not meeting proper deadlines delay old UI

review_title: It was a great place to work
job_title: Hardware Engineer in San Diego, CA
pros: Very professional, trusting, easy to get along with management.  High priority on work-life balance; flexible hours.  Importance of results stressed, not individuals' way of working.  No micromanaging; it was assumed that each person would contribute to the company's success in his or her own way.
cons: Some people don't contribute to the best of their ability- this sometimes seemed to be overlooked by management.  Some important areas were not keeping up with the capabilities and needs of the market, and caused slow response to consumers' demands for up to date products.

review_title: Nokia not bad to work but defiantly a sinking ship.  Not a winner
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: Some nice smart people. Good salary when they actually paid bonuses.  Nice facilities and location.
cons: Anti American bias even at the silicon valley office.  The bias does not result in a hostile workplace.   Generally they are nice people but you can't succeed beyond your little box there unless you are a Fin.   You will notice especially among the engineers.   When a non-Fin goes for a posted rec he may get an informal chat but then the rec get closed and reopened with a slightly different description and a young man from Finland show up with the job.  The game is rigged against you.   Do your job, keep your head down, and the world is good.  There is not a culture of throwing people under the bus.

pros: Excellent work - life balance. True Finnish environment so it is best for free thinking and gives an opportunity for innovation. They are big on competency development so helps the individual grow as well. Also is a flat working environment so that increases the approach-ability and hence gives a nice feel to working with them.
cons: Cannot think of anything. even after leaving the organisation I'm still a sucker for the same. Was wonderful to work and there was always harmony within all tiers of the organisation and this brought in a feel of belonging to the employees.

review_title: A great good company that can become great ...again
pros: Nokia has undergone massive changes and and is still changing on a very fast pace , with that there are many opportunities for people that are willing to make a difference and together we can make the company one of the best if not the best in the market. Exciting new technologies and business models are making the work challenging but also very rewarding.
cons: There is a very strict regime of processes to be followed that might at certain stages impact on the creativity of people. While the management appears of more modern style the company has a significant amount of hierarchy.

pros: Powered by the research and innovation of Nokia Bell Labs, we serve communications service providers, governments, large enterprises and consumers, with the industry's most complete, end-to-end portfolio of products, services and licensing. We adhere to the highest ethical business standards as we create technology with social purpose, quality and integrity. Nokia is enabling the infrastructure for 5G and the Internet of Things to transform the human experience.
cons: We create the technology to connect the world, in a responsible way. We work to bring about a more sustainable, socially responsible world. We purposefully design technologies to drive social, environmental, and economic progress, and wherever we can, seek to harness the opportunities of connectivity for people and our planet.

review_title: Good work life balance,POOR salary and growth
pros:
Work from home facility,worked in Nokia for 7years, so found it a good advantage.
Good onsite opportunities available .
Learning is more of an individual task rather than company's liability ,so depends more upon you.
cons:
Poor management in GDC India. If you are joining in Care i.e. technical support, be prepared to have a bad work life balance, on job trainings are not given importance now. Over the past 8 years, company's overall employee satisfaction has degraded. Yearly hikes are poor.
Internal movements not welcomed by current managers, so your growth will surely get hampered.

review_title: Good place to work in terms of pay and benefits
pros: Employees are very well looked after. Benefits are very good and the company is very flexible about working hours, balancing with outside etc. Lot of support internally for development.
cons: Nokia is a global company but remains very Finland centric. If you want to progress in the company then it's advisable to spend time in Finland. That may be very limiting of course if there is no opportunity to do that in the area of business you may be in.

review_title: Great people but poorly managed globally
pros: Great open-office environment. Great people both in soft and hard skills. Everyone is easily approachable. Almost every engineer and project manager is professional, hardworking and focused, offering a great environment to learn and grow.
cons: Every 6 months since 2007 the company restructures itself to a point that some roles are either missed or roles are ambiguous. Top management is not held accountable and regions/departments are left with a uncommitted support from the top in terms of strategy with existing businesses (some of which are potentially great revenue generators if managed properly).

pros: Nokia reigned the mobile phone industry from 97 to 2009. It did so because of giving freedom to employees to choose the roles they are best at. Because of its Scandinavian roots, it has the best work-life balance. The fall of Nokia is failure of top leadership on its market strategy. On Mid to Low level, Nokia continued to perform best.
cons: As most of large companies, decision making at Nokia can take long. Due to this, company is not agile enough to adopt to fast changing market demand.

pros:
- Good learning opportunities if you are working on the right platform.
- People are good and helpful.
cons:
- If you are from a different domain, you won't get sufficient time to learn necessary things before you are put into actual work.
- The time killing agile methodology. This methodology actually kills time as we need to attend lot of meetings and lot of processes to be followed even to finish a minor work :(
- Lot of weekend work when there is any release (again depends on project)
- No recreation, cafeteria is too bad.
- Team building is very poor as everyone will be engaged only in doing work.

review_title: To in Nokia hierarchy. anyone who doesn't work in Finland gets discounted.
job_title: Senior Product Manager in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: They value work-life balance and treat their employees well. They offer a good benefits package and depending on the team you work for, there are opportunities for growth.
cons: The company cannot get out of its own way. The Finnish employees dominate all ranks of management and the only reason they come to the SF Bay Area is to recruit engineers and students. There is very little support for non-Fin VPs or Senior Management. We'll see if they'll be around long enough for Elop to change that.

review_title: Large company with plenty of opportinities.
pros: Very, open global and intercultural company, where it is possible, even recommendable, to take international assignments in order to move ahead in career. Nokia provides and supports good learning opportunities and carries responsibility about environment but also employees during lay-offs.
cons: Currently facing challenges and tough competition which is making the work stressful sometimes. It might be difficult to move ahead in career without pulling the strings. It is difficult to get rid of the friend-hiring in the large organization.

review_title: Good place to work, but not to advance career
pros: good work place and atmosphere, nice people mostly.  generous 401k matching, freebie phone, a lot of smart people
cons: ESPP has been down hill the past few years. frequent re-org, good product gets canceled, doesn't seem to know what it is doing. no opportunity for advancement. people from mother ship with no exp or little exp gets promoted, then they leave. cancel product too quick when it's not making money, not even trying.

review_title: No longer cares about its employees
pros: Pay and benefits are good
cons: It is now all about making money and no longer about having a good work-life-balance.  They will bleed you dry and then lay you off.  They now have what is called a Needs Improvement competitive mindset, where they make it so that no one shares information or knowledge just to remain employed.  No longer work as a team or support each other.  More like work till you can't work no more and you have to leave.  So much has changed, and not for the better.  So many have left on their own to try and find a more caring company.

review_title: The decline of the once great Nokia
pros:
International presence helps diversify the business.
Still good brand name in Nokia.
Very good people at working levels
cons:
Lack of clear direction.
Product quality and content lags competition.
Short term focus.
Wasted opportunities.
No carrot, only sticks.
Missing a strong, charismatic leadership team.

job_title: Product Manager in Helsinki, Southern Finland
pros: Mostly great colleagues, interesting work.
cons: Management started to appreciate mostly native English speakers. (There was increasing amount of native English speaking managers, who seemed to think that your ability to speak fluent English is correlating with your intelligence). This attitude created a bad work environment. I have understood, that these people were fired when Nokia decided to go for Windows OS.

review_title: Very good if you get to the right department
pros:
- Good atmosphere in teams
- Smaller but demanding projects, some of them based on very modern technologies
- Managers acting like friends rather than like bosses
- Many young ambitious people
- Decent salaries, many benefits
- Team parties every once in a while
- I was never asked to stay overhours
cons:
- I heard that in other departments that the one I was working things aren't so beautiful
- Quite frequent changes of office location (if it's a problem for somebody)
- Some less effective employees feel a little too comfortable and are not motivated to try harder

review_title: Great company to start your career
job_title: R&D Engineer in Quezon City, National Capital Region
pros:
- Good work culture
- Work life balance (gyms, physical fitness class, e-games, party and a lot more)
- High starting salary (for new hire)
- Wide access to technical references (books, web and classroom training)
cons:
- Low yearly increase (new hires w/ same role even have higher rate)
- Job promotions  takes too long
- Promotions are not compensated well enough

job_title: Global Business Analyst in San Diego, CA
pros: Nokia is great. Great Work Life Balance. Managers really care about you. International travel. Laid back atmosphere. Good products
cons: Top performers get laid off because of constant reorganizations. Not marketing to the US market the way they should be.

review_title: Large company, slow to make decisions, great work/life balance and benefits
pros: Globally known company, opportunity to work with people all over the world, environmentally progressive, great benefits, flexible hours and good work/life balance.  You never have to pay your own phone bill. :)  Also you get to try out the latest Nokia phones before they hit the market.
cons: The company is so large that sometimes it's hard to have much of an impact.  There are re-orgs and chnages in management structure almost every year.  Management is often very slow at making decisions, which can be frustrating and sometimes prevents moving forward with projects.  Also some projects never see the light of day.

pros: Sallary is paid on time and it's ok for the responsabilities and duties of the position. Great balance if it's going to be your "first job" and you still live with your parents...
cons:
...if not, ...well, maybe you wanna think twice.
No career oportunities or chances to grow up. 
Good resources are not valuable for the management, so doesen't matter at all if you work hard, or average at best...in the end, you get nothing, you get tired of the rutine, and you go by yourself to another company...or you get fired.

pros: Extremely welcoming atmosphere.  On my very first day I was invited to lunch with my lab group and then we pretty much all went and got lunch together everyday over the course of the entire internship!  The friendliness definitely helped me ease into a new internship! Competitive pay. Access to whatever I needed.
cons: Sometimes the work seemed to get a little jumbled.  Different teams would be working on conflicting projects.  From an internship standpoint, I probably could have handled being given more work.  Spent some time sitting around with nothing to do.

pros: Reasonable salary, excellent PTO policy.  Generally, there is a yearly bonus and raise, though there was no raise offered this year, at least at the lower levels of the company...
cons: A lot of time wasted blaming other groups for issues and not enough time spent collaborating to figure out solutions.  Many services outsourced to other companies and/or countries to take advantage of cheaper labor.  Almost always reactive to problems; rarely proactive.

review_title: Great place but management ruins it
pros: Great cultural diversity, excellent benefits,  supportive atmosphere for the most part.
cons:
Salary is low, bonus structure is terrible and they do not like to give big bonuses to those who deserve it (politics/favortism—- not based on actual performance like it should be).

Management is terrible. Dictators are with no logical reasoning or transparency. Lack of respect for workers time and lack of appreciation of employees.

review_title: Stable company, ideal for entry level!
pros: This is a very big company, with excellent work-life balance and very progressive mode of operation.  There are also some nice benefits that add to the overall compensation package. Employees get respect and support in almost all cases. I would highly recommend it to someone who is fresh out of school and looking for his/her first gig!
cons: It is difficult if not impossible to progress satisfactorily in the company. Promotions and raises are scarce and that is why the company has to deal with high attrition rates.

pros: Good work-life balance, working from home allowed, a big company so lots of opportunities in the house, pretty good benefits,
cons: Restructurings quite frequently, currently a bit difficult situation but good lookout in the future

review_title: Nokia india working environment, growth and salaries
pros:
Nokia work environment is quite good, it gives you independence to work. Work-life balance is very good. You will never feel any pressure at work.

Nokia Salaries are quite good, comparable to  other internet companies like Yahoo
cons:
Nokia India is another typical MNC which treats its own India center as "services company". i.e very fragmented work comes to Bangalore. Main control still stays in Finland. So, whenever there is downturn, the teams that get cut are from India. 

The downside of higher salaries is that it makes difficult to get another job outside of Nokia as your salaries will be above average and the opportunities shrink

review_title: Good work life balance but poor employee appreciation.
pros:
Work life balance
Flexible work timings
Most of time appropriate time is given to complete the tasks.
Improved product develop framework which makes delivering the products easier and faster
cons:
poor salary hikes
incompetent management
growth is based on who you can approach in company
products are non transparent, people working on one layer of a product may not even have a little knowledge of other layers
Only self learning or e learning, no internal or external trainings, in three years i have never got an invite for a training. 
Frequent re-orgs, only managers get benefit of that.
Performance evaluation is baseless, managers changes within months.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Rancho Bernardo, CA
pros: Posters all over the Rancho Benardo building about Empathy for one another and doing the right thing, walking to a co-worker to see them in person rather than emailing them - how it can be beneficial. . .
cons: Nokia seemed pre occupied with clawing their way back, hoping the Microsoft partnership will be their ticket back to a lead role in the ever-changing telecom market place.  Well it doesn't mean to not pay attention still to the humans.

pros:
Personal growth : I started working with NSN as a fresher. As fresher,  for me opportunities were decent. Team members were helpful. 

Office Culture : I had noting to complain. But cost cutting was a big comedy.

Benefits : Depends on manager. I had a cool and supportive manager. My efforts were rewarded.
cons:
Company values : I felt values were changing constantly . Some how I feel NSN is in a process of  constant change ( may not be good )

Leadership : There were lot of restructuring and reorganization. It may be due to aimless leadership.

Compensation : It depends on department you are in. I had seen both extremes

job_title: ION Solution Specialist in Ciudad de Mexico
pros: It is a gptw, facilities are amazing and also Nokia is concerned about their employees, they offer you trainings so that you can make the best performance.
cons:
From my perspective, organization could be improved a little bit by giving the employees easier ways to acquire some facilities like the laptop (I think that, when you arrive, you should not wait for the OS image and the installation).

Besides this, I think that the coffee machine could be improved by changing the use of disposable glasses. From my perspective, a machine that only offers the product without giving you the recipient could be better. I mean, we could save resources by using real glasses or cups.

review_title: Nokia Siemens Networks... keep your eyes wide open and your options open
pros: Global company. Opportunity for global work experience and working with professionals from other cultures.
cons: Lack of focus in company since merger between Nokia Networks and Siemens Communications in 2007...integregation of the 2 companies has been difficult especially while under threat of stiff market competition globally and decreasing margins.

review_title: Still a good company to stay
pros:
- My first telco multinational company
- Flexible working hours, i can go to office little bit late, or even working from home rarely
- Many compensation packages
- Open communication
- Still a secure place to work during this global financial crisis
cons:
- Unclear career path yet
- Prefer to recruit external new experts rather than developing the current employee
- Working as costumer facing teams do like a front line fleet in the war. Sometimes it's difficult to seek a backup from management and product development while customer killing us with their complaints. Sometimes we do get better support from selling 3rd party product than the internal product.

pros: Competitive salaries, normal stress level for a technology company of its size. Sometimes, the splendors of the great times shine through, with fancy meeting rooms, fancy saunas in the wildnerness, for those lucky to see that.
cons: Nokia was once a great place to work, but with all the strategy "adjustments" and constant layoffs, all the people that made the company great left. What's left is people clinging to their jobs, hoping not to be in the next batch who has to leave.

review_title: Incredible experience working with great people on cutting edge technology and systems
pros: Particularly nice benefit program.  Impressive vacation time potential for those who have put in the years.  Great people who desperately desire to see this company return as the market leader.  Come on NOK stock!
cons: Room for advancement and individual innovation.  However, once you hit a particular career level, it becomes necessary to either manage a group or move to Finland.  Concerned that not everything is being done to reach the America's market, but I know it can't happen in one year or even a few years.

pros: Good benefits, mobile, etc. nice environment including gym, sauna, flexible working time, possibility for teleworking, very nice collegues and boss :-)
cons: Annual organization changes were eating 2 month of efficient working time every year, since after change we need to look around who are our new team collaborators in new org, then negosiate and agree responsibility areas of new teams

review_title: Poorly Organized. Not clear with the future goals
job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Plano, TX
pros: Good bonus in past 3-4 years. Big cubicles at the most work locations.
cons:
Video Business Unit: now a part of Velocix. Not clear with the future goals. Business Unit had 3 re-organization happening in 1 year. 
Can't rely on work visa /green card sponsorship commitments, even if they start the process. It would be super slow.  
Most of the people are with the company for more than a decade ( former ALU, DSC) not because its good place to work at but because the job is relaxed.  Good place to work at if you want to enjoy semi retirement work life.
